metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: AngularJS Controllers
AngularJS controllers control the data of AngularJS applications.
content.html: AngularJS controllers control the data of AngularJS applications.

content.text: AngularJS controllers are regular JavaScript Objects .
content.html: AngularJS controllers are regular JavaScript Objects.

content.text: AngularJS Controllers
AngularJS applications are controlled by controllers.
content.html: AngularJS applications are controlled by controllers.

content.text: The ng-controller directive defines the application controller.
content.html: The ng-controller directive defines the application controller.

content.text: A controller is a JavaScript Object , created by a standard JavaScript object constructor .
content.html: A controller is a JavaScript Object, created by a standard JavaScript object constructor.

content.code:
First Name:
Last Name:

Full Name:{{firstName + " " + lastName}}
content.code_html:
<div ng-app="myApp" ng-controller="myCtrl">

First Name: <input type="text" ng-model="firstName"><br>
Last Name: <input type="text" ng-model="lastName"><br>
<br>
Full Name: {{firstName + " " + lastName}}

</div>

<script>
var app = angular.module('myApp', []);
app.controller('myCtrl', function($scope) {
  $scope.firstName = "John";
  $scope.lastName = "Doe";
});
</script>

content.text: Application explained:
content.html: Application explained:

content.text: The AngularJS application is defined by ng-app="myApp" . The application runs inside the <div>.
content.html: The AngularJS application is defined by  ng-app="myApp". The application runs inside the <div>.

content.text: The ng-controller="myCtrl" attribute is an AngularJS directive. It defines a controller.
content.html: The ng-controller="myCtrl" attribute is an AngularJS directive. It defines a controller.

content.text: The myCtrl function is a JavaScript function.
content.html: The myCtrl function is a JavaScript function.

content.text: AngularJS will invoke the controller with a $scope object.
content.html: AngularJS will invoke the controller with a $scope object.

content.text: In AngularJS, $scope is the application object (the owner of application variables and functions).
content.html: In AngularJS, $scope is the application object (the owner of application variables and functions).

content.text: The controller creates two properties (variables) in the scope ( firstName and lastName ).
content.html: The controller creates two properties (variables) in the scope (firstName and lastName).

content.text: The ng-model directives bind the input fields to the controller properties (firstName and lastName).
content.html: The ng-model directives bind the input fields to the controller properties (firstName and lastName).

content.text: Controller Methods
The example above demonstrated a controller object with two properties: lastName and firstName.
content.html: The example above demonstrated a controller object with two properties: lastName and firstName.

content.text: A controller can also have methods (variables as functions):
content.html: A controller can also have methods (variables as functions):

content.code:
First Name:
Last Name:

Full Name:{{fullName()}}
content.code_html:
<div ng-app="myApp" ng-controller="personCtrl">

First Name: <input type="text" ng-model="firstName"><br>
Last Name: <input type="text" ng-model="lastName"><br>
<br>
Full Name: {{fullName()}}

</div>

<script>
var app = angular.module('myApp', []);
app.controller('personCtrl', function($scope) {
  $scope.firstName = "John";
  $scope.lastName = "Doe";
  $scope.fullName = function() {
    return $scope.firstName + " " + $scope.lastName;
  };
});
</script>

content.text: Controllers In External Files
In larger applications, it is common to store controllers in external files.
content.html: In larger applications, it is common to store controllers in external files.

content.text: Just copy the code between the <script> tags into an external file named personController.js :
content.html: Just copy the code between the <script> tags into an external file named personController.js:

content.code:
First Name:
Last Name:

Full Name:{{fullName()}}
content.code_html:
<div ng-app="myApp" ng-controller="personCtrl">

First Name: <input type="text" ng-model="firstName"><br>
Last Name: <input type="text" ng-model="lastName"><br>
<br>
Full Name: {{fullName()}}

</div>

<script src="personController.js"></script>

content.text: Another Example
For the next example we will create a new controller file:
content.html: For the next example we will create a new controller file:

content.text: Save the file as namesController.js :
content.html: Save the file as namesController.js:

content.text: And then use the controller file in an application:
content.html: And then use the controller file in an application:

content.code: • {{ x.name + ', ' + x.country }}
content.code_html:
<div ng-app="myApp" ng-controller="namesCtrl">

<ul>
  <li ng-repeat="x in names">
    {{ x.name + ', ' + x.country }}
  </li>
</ul>

</div>

<script src="namesController.js"></script>
